intro: Chrysopsis grandis, commonly known as the grand larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy, often toxic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its flowers are blue to violet in color, with five petals and prominent yellow stamens. Chrysopsis grandis is characterized by its tall, slender stems and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
